title: Kylie Jenner 'files restraining order' against stalker fan
text:
The man reportedly showed up at Kylie’s home (Picture: Rex)

Kylie Jenner has reportedly filed a restraining order against a man who showed up at her home and demanded to see her.

The guy in question was said to have visited the makeup mogul’s home on 29 October, walking up to her driveway and aggressively knocking at the door, according to documents obtained by TMZ.

The documents, which were filed by Kylie’s lawyer Shawn Chapman Holley, also state that the man claimed he was there to see her, before a security guard escorted him off the property. The man was subsequently arrested.

A security guard later filed legal documents stating that the man was behaving erratically, and was still able to find his way onto the property and get to Kylie’s front door, despite the fact that she lives in a gated community.

Although Kylie was not at home during the incident, she is reportedly ‘scared’ for the safety of herself and her daughter, one-year-old Stormi, and is worried that the guy will continue to stalk her and try and visit her home again in the future.

The man has since been ordered to stay 100 yards away from Kylie herself as well as her home and car.

It comes after model Blac Chyna has also found herself involved in a lawsuit with the Kardashian family, over her axed TV series Rob & Chyna.

Blac Chyna has also found herself involved in a lawsuit with the Kardashian family (Picture: STARMAX/Backgrid)

In legal documents filed by Chyna, she claimed the Keeping Up With The Kardashians stars were behind the decision for her show to be cancelled by network E!, although they strongly deny this.

The case is set to be taken to court next year.

Reps for Kylie declined to comment when approached by Metro.co.uk.
